extendedIngredients.name: avocado
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 ripe avocado, peeled, pitted and finely diced

extendedIngredients.name: bay leaf
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 bouquet garni of 1 bay leaf, 3 sprigs fresh thyme & 3 springs fresh parsley tied in a piece of cheesecloth

extendedIngredients.name: black beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound dried black beans, picked through and rinsed

extendedIngredients.name: carrots
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 carrots, cut into 2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: celery
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 ribs celery, cut into 2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: cooked mung beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups firm-cooked black beans

extendedIngredients.name: fresh cilantro
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup finely chopped fresh cilantro

extendedIngredients.name: fresh corn kernels
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup corn kernels (fresh & cooked or frozen & thawed)

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 cloves garlic, peeled

extendedIngredients.name: green bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ green bell pepper, cored and seeded

extendedIngredients.name: ground cumin
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ teaspoon ground cumin

extendedIngredients.name: jalapeno peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 jalapeño peppers, seeded and minced

extendedIngredients.name: lime juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons lime juice

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small onion, cut in half

extendedIngredients.name: oregano
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ teaspoon dried oregano

extendedIngredients.name: poblano chile
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 poblano chile, seeded and finely diced

extendedIngredients.name: red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ red bell pepper, cored, seeded and finely diced

extendedIngredients.name: red onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup finely diced red onion

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

recipes.title: Black Bean Salsa

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé are great choices for Salsa. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. You could try Bernardus Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.7 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 48 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bernardus Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: The Santa Lucia Highlands are known as one of the premier Pinot Noir appellations of the world. One reason for this lofty reputation is Rosella's Vineyard. Gary Franscioni planted his home ranch, named for his lovely wife, in the heart of the Highlands. Gary's home vineyard is planted with a selection of the best available Pinot Noir clones and farmed with unparalleled passion and attention to detail. We at Bernardus are fortunate to have access to three small blocks: 2 planted with clone 777, and the third with the celebrated Pisoni clone.Each block is individually monitored for ripeness in order to hand-pick each clone at its perfect ripeness level. The grapes are sorted at the winery and fermented in small individual fermenters using specially selected yeasts. Once fermentation and pressing are complete, each lot is aged separately for 10 months in the finest French oak barrels. Each barrel is evaluated individually and the final selection is made through a lengthy series of tasting trials.The robe of our 2011 Rosella's is a deep crimson. On the nose we find aromas of candied red cherry fruits along with notes of oak and spice. The palate is very full and complex, exuding flavors of red cherry and berries, accented by notes of cinnamon and nutmeg. This is a beautifully intense wine that will age wonderfully for many years to come.

recipes.instructions: 1. For the Firm-Cooked Black Beans: In a large, heavy stockpot, soak the beans in cold water to cover by at least 3 inches for no less than 4 hours, or overnight.2. Add the vegetables, garlic, bouquet garni, cumin and oregano to the pot of beans and soaking water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Skim off any foam that rises to the surface.3. Reduce the heat and gently simmer the beans, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until tender, 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes. Add water as necessary to keep the beans submerged.4. Season the beans with salt and pepper during the last 10 minutes of cooking. Drain the beans in a colander and rinse with cold water. Remove and discard the vegetables and bouquet garni. The beans are now ready to be used in the salsa, or they can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.5. Assemble the Salsa: Combine all of the ingredients for the salsa in a mixing bowl and toss well. Add more salt or lime juice as needed. Serve with your favorite tortilla chips.Note #1: If you do not have cheesecloth for the bouquet garni, you can also use a coffee filter.Note #2: If you prefer to not cook the beans yourself, you can use 2 cups of canned (rinsed and drained) black beans. If you do this, be sure to taste for seasoning adjustments. You will likely need to use more cumin, salt and pepper.

steps.step: For the Firm-Cooked Black Beans: In a large, heavy stockpot, soak the beans in cold water to cover by at least 3 inches for no less than 4 hours, or overnight.2.

Add the vegetables, garlic, bouquet garni, cumin and oregano to the pot of beans and soaking water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Skim off any foam that rises to the surface.3. Reduce the heat and gently simmer the beans, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until tender, 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes.
Add water as necessary to keep the beans submerged.4. Season the beans with salt and pepper during the last 10 minutes of cooking.
Drain the beans in a colander and rinse with cold water.

steps.step: Combine all of the ingredients for the salsa in a mixing bowl and toss well.
Add more salt or lime juice as needed.

Serve with your favorite tortilla chips.Note #1: If you do not have cheesecloth for the bouquet garni, you can also use a coffee filter.Note #2: If you prefer to not cook the beans yourself, you can use 2 cups of canned (rinsed and drained) black beans. If you do this, be sure to taste for seasoning adjustments. You will likely need to use more cumin, salt and pepper.
